E-commerce Web Application (Manual Testing)

Role :

Manual QA Tester

length :

1 Week

Tools & Platforms:

Qase.io

Jira

Chrome DevTools

Desktop & Mobile Web

overview.

This project demonstrates end-to-end manual testing of an e-commerce web application, including user registration, search & product discovery, product details, cart, and checkout flows. Test cases were executed across desktop and mobile web platforms, with defects logged in Jira and test management handled in Qase.

objective.

To validate critical workflows, identify functional, validation, and UX defects, and demonstrate professional QA methodology.

test coverage.

Total Test Cases Executed: 37

  • Passed: 32

  • Failed: 3

  • Blocked / Skipped: 2

Tested flows :

  • Authentication / User Registration

  • Product Search & Discovery

  • Product Details Page (PDP)

  • Shopping Cart

  • Checkout

  • Cross-Platform Testing: Desktop & Mobile Web

key defects & observations.

Defect / Observation Type Severity Description

OTP not delivered during new user registration

Functional

Critical

Prevents new users from creating accounts; no error message or fallback

Invalid email format accepted during registration

Validation

High

Allows incorrect user data; affects authentication & communication

Search results return unrelated products

Functional / UX

Medium

Reduces search accuracy and product discoverability

Checkout session remains active during inactivity

Observation / UX

Low

Potential risk for user confusion or session misuse
